The American Socialist (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: The American Socialist Summary: From Pat Deveney's database: American Socialist. 1876—1879 Weekly Oneida, NY. Publisher: Oneida & Wallingford Communities. Editor: John Humphrey Noyes, William A. Hinds. 1/1, March 30, 1876-December 25, 1879. This was the "new series" of the Oneida Circular, the weekly organ of the perfectionist and socialist communities founded by John Humphrey Noyes (1811-1886) in Oneida, New York, and Wallingford, Connecticut. Noyes had firmly rejected spiritualism and the Rochester rappings in 1851, but by 1874 had come to see its usefulness, as the journal reflects. LOC. Issues:The American Socialist V1 N40 Dec 28 1876
